metadata.title: CVE-2022-31737 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A malicious webpage could have caused an out-of-bounds write in WebGL,leading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.10, Firefox < 101, and Firefox ESR <91.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
